verdict.summary: Another Terraform process holds the state lock or a previous run crashed without releasing it.

dead_ends.why_fails: Permanently loses all resource tracking, causing orphaned infrastructure
Creates race conditions when multiple users apply simultaneously

workarounds.action: Force unlock the state with the lock ID
If the lock is stale, use terraform force-unlock with the lock ID
workarounds.how:
# The error message contains the Lock ID:
# Lock Info: ID: a1b2c3d4-e5f6-...
terraform force-unlock a1b2c3d4-e5f6-...
# For S3/DynamoDB backend, verify no active process first:
aws dynamodb scan --table-name terraform-locks

workarounds.action: Use terraform plan and check state access before running in CI
workarounds.how:
# In CI/CD pipeline, add retry logic and lock timeout:
terraform plan -lock-timeout=5m
terraform apply -lock-timeout=5m -auto-approve
# Or serialize runs in CI to avoid concurrent state access:
# Use a CI job queue or concurrency group

leads_to.condition: After unlock, re-init may be needed to restore providers

preceded_by.condition: Cycle error crashed apply leaving lock behind
